main event: Two prospectors reported a large circular object crashing to the ground in Death Valley, California, and saw two 'small men' heavily clothed, running from the crash and disappearing over a ridge.
interesting points: The object was described as approximately 24 feet in diameter and 7 feet thick, made of a ceramic material, and was heavily iridescent and radioactive.
One of the witnesses had a scientific background and identified the material as primarily calcium, with small green wires running throughout.
The object was observed to have rings on its entire outer surface, resembling the turret of a tank.
The report indicates that the object was recovered by the two 'small men' who ran from the crash.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) forwarded this information to the Officer in Charge at Headquarters District 13 OSI, Haywood, California, for their information.
sighted object: large circular object crashing to the ground
